definition:
[@steen] Suppose $X$ is a topological space. Further, suppose that for
any two disjoint closed sets $A,B\subseteq X$, there are two disjoint
open sets $U$ and $V$ such that $A\subseteq U$ and $B\subseteq V$. Then
we say that $X$ is a *$T_4$ space*.

### Notes {#notes .unnumbered}

It should be pointed out that there is no standard convention for
separation axioms in topology. The above definition follows [@steen].
However, in some references (e.g. [@kelley]) the meaning of $T_4$ and
normal are exchanged.

[9]{} L.A. Steen, J.A.Seebach, Jr., *Counterexamples in topology*, Holt,
Rinehart and Winston, Inc., 1970. J.L. Kelley, *General Topology*, D.
van Nostrand Company, Inc., 1955.
